source.47deeb91:
import re

def processTweets(tweet):
    '''Cleans the tweet and returns it'''
    tweet = str(tweet)
    tweet = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]','',tweet) # Remove Punctuations
    return tweet

df['tweet'] = df['tweet'].apply(processTweets)

stopwords = set(STOPWORDS)
wordcloud = WordCloud(stopwords=stopwords,
                      background_color="black",
                      width = 1080,
                      height = 1080).generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize = (20, 10))
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.show()

source.1b9e93b6:
Now we check the data of tweets over the years.We will see the trends of the total of each feature as well as the median value of each feature.

It is important to note certain events in this regard.

1.In 2015, a lot of speculations were around that Joe Biden would run for president in 2016 presidential election. But these speculations turned out to be false.

2.In early 2017, Joe Biden said adios to the office as his second tenure as the Vice President of USA came to an end.

3.2018 was the year that saw the return of Biden as he rallied the Democrats in the mid-term elections.

4.In 2019, Biden announced that he will be running for the OVal office.

5.2020, well, this was the year when he won the race to the office.
source.f6d81900: Joseph Robinette Biden Jr, an American politician, is the 46th and current president of the United States. A member of the Democratic Party, he served as the 47th vice president from 2009 to 2017 under Barack Obama and represented Delaware in the United States Senate from 1973 to 2009.
source.0e5b1332: From both the two set of plots, it is clear that Biden's twitter activity as well as interaction of other users with his tweets increased since 2016, with a massive increase between 2019 and 2020
source.155fe393: Let us see how much Mr.Biden has been posting on twitter
